result.execSummary:
The defendant Geoffrey A Joseph was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Geoffrey A Joseph

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission
Reminder Notice

Count 1:  Non-Probation
Count 2:  Non-Probation
filed by Atty Oren Jakobson

8:53 AM Defendant Geoffrey A Joseph in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Geoffrey A Joseph.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State is going to be filing an AMENDED INFORMATION.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
AMENDED Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - No contest 

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of AMENDED Count 1:  Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Injunction 813.125(7) and guilty on Count 2:  Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Injunction 813.125(7).
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.

ADA Cassidy makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Jakobson makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant makes a brief statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1:
Pay a fine of $500 plus costs, including the DNA Surcharge
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office today
Submit DNA Sample 

Count 2:
Pay a fine of $500 plus costs, including the DNA Surcharge
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office today
Submit DNA Sample
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
matter set for plea/sent 10/18/22 at 8:30

11:01 AM Defendant Geoffrey A Joseph in court.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Geoffrey A Joseph. 
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

4:53 PM Defendant Geoffrey A Joseph in court.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Geoffrey A Joseph. 

Officer A. Lee is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Cassidy. 
Witness has identified the defendant. 
Cross exam by Atty Jakobson. 

Atty Jakobson makes arguments to the court. 
Atty Cassidy makes arguments to the court. 
BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on August 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Victim rights have be complied with and no victim present.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:16 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Geoffrey A Joseph in court. 

Defendant verifies his address.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant would like to proceed with an attorney and will contact the public defender or get a private attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Court asks the defendant to go to the public defender today to see if he qualifies.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant may need to reapply with the public defender's office.

Court will adjourn to allow the defendant time to retain or get counsel appointed.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 16, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Letter to the Defendant in re:  signing AMENDED Cash Bond with conditions listed
mailed on 03/29/22 sp

Comply with requirements of the current injunction order: No contact, in person, in writing, digitally, or through a third party. No contact with C.E.M.'s residence or place of employment.
No contact with Aspirus St. Michael's Hospital in Stevens Point.

1:07 PM Defendant Geoffrey Alexander Joseph appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Brian Pfeil. Atty Max Bergner appears in person for the defendant.
Atty Pfeil calls the case and states appearances.
ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Violating a Temporary Restraining Order or Injunction (Multiple) and Felony Stalking. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Atty Bergner states that the public defender's office will not be representing the defendant at this time.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $1000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner makes arguments for a signature bond.
Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
